titles.title: TEACH Act of 2012
Teacher Education for Autistic Children Act of 2012
TEACH Act of 2012

To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a refundable tax credit for education and training expenses relating to autism spectrum disorders to increase the number of teachers with such expertise.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: Teacher Education for Autistic Children Act of 2012 or the TEACH Act of 2012 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a refundable income tax credit for up to $10,000 of the annual education expenses (e.g., tuition, books, student loan interest) incurred by individuals studying to become teachers of children or adults with an autism spectrum disorder. Terminates such credit after 2017.
